required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Post Marketing Surveillance Study To Observe Safety And Efficacy Of Toviaz (Registered)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to determine the problems and questions of safety and efficacy of Toviaz® under the standard conditions of usage.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time that the participant signed data privacy statement through and including 28 calendar days after the last administration of the study drug.
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject administered a product or medical device; the event was not necessarily had a causal relationship with the treatment or usage. All AEs reported after start of administration of Toviaz were considered as TEAEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Investigator's Final Assessment of Effectiveness at the End of Study Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of study treatment
primary_outcome.description: The final efficacy assessment included improvement, no change, aggravation, and unevaluable evaluated by the investigator based on the subject's symptoms of frequent micturition, urgency, and urgency urinary incontinence (UUI).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Number of Micturitions Per 24 Hours at the End of Study Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at the end of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The number of micturitions per 24 hours was recorded in the case report form (CRF) by the investigator. Baseline was defined as data collected within 1 week prior to the first visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Number of Urgency Episodes Per 24 Hours at the End of Study Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at the end of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The number of urgency episodes per 24 hours was recorded in the CRF by the investigator. Baseline was defined as data collected within 1 week prior to the first visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Number of UUI Episodes Per 24 Hours at the End of Study Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at the end of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The number of UUI episodes per 24 hours was recorded in the CRF by the investigator. Baseline was defined as data collected within 1 week prior to the first visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant Perception of Bladder Condition at the End of Study Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at the end of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Participant perception of bladder condition was recorded in the CRF by the investigator. Participants were asked at baseline (BL) and at the end of study treatment (EOT) if the extent to which their bladder condition caused them problems. The possible responses were: No Problem, Very Minor Problems, Minor Problems, Moderate Problems, Severe Problems, or Many Severe Problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Final Efficacy Assessment of Effective by Baseline and Treatment Characteristics
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who were assessed as having improved from their baseline condition in the final efficacy assessment were considered as "effective". Baseline and treatment characteristics included: geriatric status (<65 years or ≥65 years), age categories, gender, weight categories, height categories, allergic history, duration of disease, past overactive bladder (OAB) treatment history, medical history, kidney and liver disorders, concomitant medication, total administration period of Toviaz, completion status, daily dose of Toviaz, and long term administration of Toviaz (<274 days and ≥274 days) .

arm_group.description: All patients who enrolled in this study

intervention.description: 4 mg starting then can be followed by 8 mg

study_pop.textblock: - Subjects who are diagnosed as Overactive Bladder (OAB) defined as urgency, with or without urgency incontinence, usually with frequency and nocturia, in the absence of local or metabolic factors explaining these factors.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who are diagnosed as Overactive Bladder (OAB) defined as urgency, with or without urgency incontinence, usually with frequency and nocturia, in the absence of local or metabolic factors explaining these factors.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypersensitivity to the active substance or to peanut or soya or any of the excipients
- Urinary retention
- Gastric retention
- Uncontrolled narrow angle glaucoma
- Myasthenia gravis
- Severe hepatic impairment (Child Pugh C)
- Concomitant use of potent CYP3A4 inhibitors in subjects with moderate to severe hepatic or renal impairment
- Severe ulcerative colitis
- Toxic megacolon
- Patients with rare hereditary problems of galactose intolerance, the Lapp lactase deficiency or glucose-galactose malabsorption (Toviaz® prolonged-release tablets contain lactose)

facility.name: Yoo And Lee Dematology Urology Clinic
Lee and Lee dermatology urology clinic

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled between November 2009 and August 2014 from 235 Korean medical care centers.

group.title: Toviaz
group.description: Participants were administered with Toviaz as part of routine care. The use and dosage recommendations for Toviaz were based on the approved local product document and were adjusted solely according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

baseline.population: Safety Analysis Set: regardless of treatment period, all participants who received study drug once or more, including dropouts due to adverse event (AE), were included in the safety analysis set. Participants who started Toviaz prior to the contract date or violated usage of maximum daily dose of 8 mg were excluded from the safety analysis set.

outcome.title: Investigator's Final Assessment of Effectiveness at the End of Study Treatment
outcome.description: The final efficacy assessment included improvement, no change, aggravation, and unevaluable evaluated by the investigator based on the subject's symptoms of frequent micturition, urgency, and urgency urinary incontinence (UUI).
outcome.time_frame: At the end of study treatment
outcome.population: Per-Protocol (PP) Population: participants who had evaluable data and were eligible for the efficacy assessment of the approved indication. The method of last observation carried forward was used in the analysis of effectiveness endpoints.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Final Efficacy Assessment of Effective by Baseline and Treatment Characteristics
outcome.description: Participants who were assessed as having improved from their baseline condition in the final efficacy assessment were considered as “effective”. Baseline and treatment characteristics included: geriatric status (<65 years or ≥65 years), age categories, gender, weight categories, height categories, allergic history, duration of disease, past overactive bladder (OAB) treatment history, medical history, kidney and liver disorders, concomitant medication, total administration period of Toviaz, completion status, daily dose of Toviaz, and long term administration of Toviaz (<274 days and ≥274 days) .
outcome.time_frame: At the end of study treatment

group.title: Toviaz
group.description: Participants were administered with Toviaz as part of routine care. The use and dosage recommendations for Toviaz were based on the approved local product document and were adjusted solely according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

Baseline and treatment characteristics included: geriatric status (<65 years or ≥65 years), age categories, gender, weight categories, height categories, allergic history, duration of disease, past overactive bladder (OAB) treatment history, medical history, kidney and liver disorders, concomitant medication, total administration period of Toviaz, completion status, daily dose of Toviaz, and long term administration of Toviaz (<274 days and ≥274 days) .

class.title: Existence for Medical History of Past Disease: Yes
Existence for Medical History of Past Disease: No
Medical History of Present Disease: Yes
Medical History of Present Disease: No
Administration Period of Toviaz: 2 to <4 months
Daily Dose of Toviaz: >4 to <8 mg

analysis.groups_desc: Geriatric Status: <65 years versus (vs) Geriatric Status: ≥65 years
Comparison among Age Categories: <50 years, 50 to 59 years, 60 to 69 years, 70 to 79 years, and ≥80 years.
Comparison among Weight Categories: <50 kg, 50 to 60 kg, 60 to 70 kg, and ≥70 kg.
Comparison among Height Categories: <160 cm, 160 to 170 cm, and ≥170 cm.
Allergic History: Yes vs Allergic History: No
Comparison among Duration of Disease: <1 week, 1 to 8 weeks, 8 to 16 weeks, and ≥16 weeks.
Past OAB Treatment History: Yes vs Past OAB Treatment History: No
Medical History of Past Disease: Yes vs Medical History of Past Disease: No
Medical History of Present Disease: Yes vs Medical History of Present Disease: No
Kidney Disorder: Yes vs Kidney Disorder: No
Liver Disorder: Yes vs Liver Disorder: No
Comparison among Total Administration Period of Toviaz Subgroups: <2 months, 2 to 4 months, and ≥4 months.
Comparison among Daily Dose of Toviaz: 3 mg, 4 mg, >4 mg to <8 mg, and 8 mg.
Total Administration Period <274 days vs Total Administration Period ≥ 274 days
Concurrent Medication: Yes vs Concurrent Medication: No

reported_events.time_frame: From the time that the participant signed data privacy statement through and including 28 calendar days after the last administration of the study drug.
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a serious adverse event. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in 1 participant and as nonserious in another participant, or 1 participant may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Toviaz
group.description: Participants were administered with Toviaz as part of routine care. The use and dosage recommendations for Toviaz were based on the approved local product document and were adjusted solely according to medical and therapeutic necessity.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
